Short and sweet, good addition. But screw the environmental puzzles, as they are by no means intuitive in this one.
Most of my time was all trial and error, and not with the good Metroidvania feel to it.
He still owes Gordon a beer

Honestly it was pretty boring.

I have to say it's the worst out of 3 Half Life games (Half Life, Opposing Forces, and Blue Shift). It felt like it was too short and very small. All of the puzzle areas are either very easy or they are scripted sequences. Of course the other games had these as well, but that's all Blue Shift has; and I don't know, I might just be dumb, but a lot of these scripted scenes felt very obtrusive here. The worst one was having to circle around to where you started in an area and wait for a door to get burned through and kicked down.

The combat was also nowhere near on par with base Half Life, much less Opposing Forces. Your selection of weapons is pretty limited, you hardly have to fight anything more complex than a soldier, there are no boss encounters, and there's never a point where you have people help you out in a fire fight.

The story was also pretty disappointing. In the beginning it was just "escape Black Mesa", much like Half Life. But unlike Half Life, the story does not evolve as time progresses. Everyone just wants you dead because "orders", and you make it out easily in the end. In Half Life, your motivation slowly shifts from "I have to escape" to "I have to end this problem"; and this is done very naturally through the story.

All in all, very disappointing and It felt a little rushed, 3/10 I'd rather play any other Half Life game.

Even though this DLC is very short, for me it felt like an additional chapter for the original half-life 1 game without any extra enemies, weapons, and other staff from the Opposing force, and because it takes a few hours to complete it, the game doesn't become boring.
esta bien ver el recinto black mesa desde otra perspectiva,ademas es divertido y intuitivo.

a good story and great action

Well, after finishing the game, I find it too short and not well made.

Even with the copying of many Half Life one characteristics, it feels not like the original and more like a bad fan project.

Blue Shift, Is a side story and a good addition to Half-life.

You are playing as one of the security guards when the outbreak happens and you get to experience what really happend before and in the beginning of Half-life.


There is almost no bugs and the ingame NPC has also been edited very nicely with great little details.

The story overall is interesting and keeps on being it from start till end, even though the mod is not the longest, the side story in itself is perfect and to me, doesn't need to be any longer than it is, but would had been "nice" if it was.
It's a perfectly fine expansion that's certainly not as good as the base game but still worth playing to see what Barney was up to during the events of Half Life
A short, but worthwhile addition for anyone who liked the original half-life game

Not much is added in the content department aside from new maps, which is disappointing, and the plot is quite dialogue heavy. Nonetheless, it is Half-Life at its core which makes for a fun gaming experience. 90%
a short and sweet trip back into black mesa

This is probably the most down to earth title in the Half Life 1 trilogy. Nothing special just a regular guy want to escape. And a happy ending! Rare to see that (especially if you look at the whole franchise). Wish the Opposing Force weapons were available though.

Half-Life: Blue Shift is usually looked down upon, but in my opinion, it's pretty good. I like the idea of playing as a security guard, and some of the portions of this game were legitimately fun.

Good game.

A fun and short side story to the original half-life. I enjoyed the updated visuals/resolution to a rather older game. (was afraid it wouldn't look nice due to being played on a modern computer and monitor, but I had nothing to worry about!)   
   I did find a couple hiccups, though it might of just been my computer: I did notice the game to crash every now and then to send me to my desktop. I also found when I would respawn from dying, my character would suddenly start alt-firing with whatever weapon he had been using at the time. Not a huge issue, but rather frustrating when you usually play on a hard difficulty like me...and every shot counts! :)

About reviews...
How are those checklist format reviews helpful at all? I keep seeing more and more of them pop up and they keep getting to the top of store pages as "most helpful" when they really don't say anything. Here is an example:

---{ Graphics }---
‚òê You forget what reality is
‚òê Beautiful
‚òê Good
‚òê Decent
‚òê Bad
‚òê Don‚Äòt look too long at it
‚òë MS-DOS

---{ Gameplay }---
‚òê Very good
‚òë Good
‚òê It's just gameplay
‚òê Mehh
‚òê Watch paint dry instead
‚òê Just don't

---{ Audio }---
‚òê Eargasm
‚òê Very good
‚òê Good
‚òë Not too bad
‚òê Bad
‚òê I'm now deaf

---{ Audience }---
‚òë Kids
‚òë Teens
‚òë Adults
‚òê Grandma

---{ PC Requirements }---
‚òê Check if you can run paint
‚òë Potato
‚òê Decent
‚òê Fast
‚òê Rich boi
‚òê Ask NASA if they have a spare computer

---{ Difficulty }---
‚òê Just press 'W'
‚òë Easy
‚òê Easy to learn / Hard to master
‚òê Significant brain usage
‚òê Difficult
‚òê Dark Souls

---{ Grind }---
‚òë Nothing to grind
‚òê Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks
‚òê Isn't necessary to progress
‚òê Average grind level
‚òê Too much grind
‚òê You'll need a second live for grinding

---{ Story }---
‚òê No Story
‚òê Some lore
‚òê Average
‚òë Good
‚òê Lovely
‚òê It'll replace your life

---{ Game Time }---
‚òê Long enough for a cup of coffee
‚òê Short
‚òë Average
‚òê Long
‚òê To infinity and beyond

---{ Price }---
‚òê It's free!
‚òê Worth the price
‚òë If it's on sale
‚òê If u have some spare money left
‚òê Not recommended
‚òê You could also just burn your money

---{ Bugs }---
‚òê Never heard of
‚òë Minor bugs
‚òê Can get annoying
‚òê ARK: Survival Evolved
‚òê The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs

---{ ? / 10 }---
‚òê 1
‚òê 2
‚òê 3
‚òê 4
‚òê 5
‚òê 6
‚òê 7
‚òê 8
‚òê 9
‚òë 10

Based on the information provided, can you guess what game this review is for? What's it about? What kind of game is it?

Point is, these reviews are completely interchangeable. I bet if you took this exact review, and copy and pasted it to every game in your library, you'd get the top review for half of the games you put it on, even if you didn't change the check marks to fit each individual game.

In my opinion, the Steam community should stop encouraging this format and instead downvote them all into oblivion. Maybe it's just me, and I guess it's not THAT big a deal, but for someone that puts at least some effort into the reviews they write, it is a little disheartening that the steam community prefers lazy checklists that ultimately don't say anything specific about the games in question. Plus I don't see how they could ever actually influence someone's decision to purchase a game or not when so little information is given.

Anyone agree or am I the only one that wants to read legitimately helpful reviews for games I might be interested in?

An interesting addition to the Half-Life collection. This one adds a little bit more than many of the other home-grown ones. I'm not a fan of having so many puzzles and dear lord do I hate Head Crabs that keep appearing over and over again. That said, this was the first that felt like it added something to the Half Life story and I enjoyed that much about it.
Its not amazing, but with the discount I got for black friday which brought the price down to $0.99, I say its a great deal for what you get
Its kinda short , but Barney Calhoun being my favorite character and seeing a new view on the disaster , this game is on my list of good games.

Worth the play if you've beaten Half-Life.
Easier than the earlier two games but still fun

i think this only has value if you are a fan of Half-Life, this is just more Half-Life 1, its diet coke Half-Life 1, the game has none of the weapons added in Opposing Force, in fact it has 3 less than base Half-Life 1, there are more graphical/sound glitches for some reason, there are far less set pieces and much less interesting ones, and the thing never escalates, im pretty sure i killed like 3 Alien Grunts total in the entire game, i didnt even use the rocket launcher once because it was honestly overkill

Spoilers:

[spoiler]you know what the final fight was? 2 houndeyes and like 5 HECU Marines[/spoiler]

man, this game is EASY, and short, took me less than 3 hours to finish, also padded towards the end

basically, you buy this to shoot a bit more with HL1 mechanics and to get a little bit more of the story of Half-Life, and to its credit, the game accomplishes that
